titles.ar: باب مَا يَرِثُ الْكَبِيرُ مِنَ الْوُلْدِ دُونَ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 10 – What the eldest from the children inherits besides others

titles.ar: باب عِلَّةِ كَيْفَ صَارَ لِلذَّكَرِ سَهْمَانِ وَ لِلْأُنْثَى سَهْمٌ
titles.en: Chapter 9 – Reason how it came to be two shares (of inheritance) for the male and for the female, one share

titles.ar: باب مَا يَرِثُ الْكَبِيرُ مِنَ الْوُلْدِ دُونَ غَيْرِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 10 – What the eldest from the children inherits besides others

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/130)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا هَلَكَ الرَّجُلُ فَتَرَكَ بَنِينَ فَلِلْأَكْبَرِ السَّيْفُ وَ الدِّرْعُ وَ الْخَاتَمُ وَ الْمُصْحَفُ فَإِنْ حَدَثَ بِهِ حَدَثٌ فَلِلْأَكْبَرِ مِنْهُمْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the man dies, and he leaves sons. So, for the eldest is the sword, and the armour, and the ring, and the Parchment. So if there befalls with him what befalls (death), so it is for the eldest among them’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When a man dies and leaves behind sons, the eldest son receives the sword, coat of arms, the ring and his (holy) book. If something happens to him then such items belong to the eldest son.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: كالحسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/131)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا ( عليهما السلام ) أَنَّ

text: الرَّجُلَ إِذَا تَرَكَ سَيْفاً وَ سِلَاحاً فَهُوَ لِابْنِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ بَنُونَ فَهُوَ لِأَكْبَرِهِمْ .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Ibn Azina, from one of his companions,

(It has been narrated) from one of the two<sup>asws</sup> (5<sup>th</sup> or 6<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) that the man, when he leaves (as legacy), a sword and weapons, so it is for his son, and if there were two sons for him, so it is for the eldest one’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ibn ’Udhaynah from certain persons of his people who has narrated the following: “One of the two Imam, (abu Ja‘far or abu ‘Abd Allah), ‘Alayhim al-Salam, has said, ‘If a man leaves behind a sword and arms and sons, such items belong to the eldest son.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/132)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا مَاتَ الرَّجُلُ فَلِلْأَكْبَرِ مِنْ وُلْدِهِ سَيْفُهُ وَ مُصْحَفُهُ وَ خَاتَمُهُ وَ دِرْعُهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Rabie Bin Abdullah,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the man dies, so for the eldest from his sons is his sword, and his Parchment, and his ring, and his armour’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ‘Rib‘iy who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When a man dies, his sword, holy book, his ring and coat of arms belong to his eldest son.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/132)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا مَاتَ الرَّجُلُ فَسَيْفُهُ وَ خَاتَمُهُ وَ مُصْحَفُهُ وَ كُتُبُهُ وَ رَحْلُهُ وَ رَاحِلَتُهُ وَ كِسْوَتُهُ لِأَكْبَرِ وُلْدِهِ فَإِنْ كَانَ الْأَكْبَرُ ابْنَةً فَلِلْأَكْبَرِ مِنَ الذُّكُورِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Rabie Bin Abdullah,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the man dies, from his sword, and his ring, and his Parchment, and his books, and his rides, and his luggage, and his ride, and his clothes are for the eldest child, and if the eldest was his daughter, so it is for the eldest from the males’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from ‘Rib‘iy ibn ‘Abd Allah who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When a man dies, his sword, ring, holy book, his books, his personal belongings, his stumper and clothes belong to his eldest son and if the eldest among his children is a girl then such items belong to the next eldest son.’”
